 Vad vi erbjuder:
   

  

* Möjlighet att påverka Sveriges mest spännande industriprojekt
* Kollegor som är lika kunniga som de är prestigelösa
* Flexibla arbetsformer och fokus på balans i livet
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och kunskapsdelning


 Några av våra förmåner är bland annat
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.


 Låter det intressant?
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra ifrån dig! Skicka in din ansökan redan idag då urvalet sker löpande. Har du frågor om rollen, kontakta gärna Azra Dajic på azra.dajic@cgi.com. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Ensemble, en tant que propriétaires, mettons notre savoir-faire à l’œuvre.**
 La vie chez CGI est ancrée dans l’actionnariat, le travail d’équipe, le respect et un sentiment d’appartenance. Chez nous, vous pourrez exploiter votre plein potentiel parce que…
   

  

 Nous vous invitons à devenir propriétaire dès le jour 1 alors que nous travaillons ensemble à faire de notre rêve une réalité. C’est pourquoi nous nous désignons comme associés de CGI, plutôt que comme employés. Nous tirons profit des retombées de notre succès collectif et contribuons activement à l’orientation et à la stratégie de notre entreprise.
   

  

 Votre travail crée de la valeur. Vous élaborerez des solutions novatrices et développerez des relations durables avec vos collègues et clients, tout en ayant accès à des capacités mondiales pour concrétiser vos idées, saisir de nouvelles opportunités, et bénéficier d’une expertise sectorielle et technologique de pointe.
   

  

 Vous ferez évoluer votre carrière en vous joignant à une entreprise bâtie pour croître et durer. Vous serez soutenus par des leaders qui ont votre santé et bien-être à cœur et qui vous permettront de saisir des occasions afin de parfaire vos compétences et élargir les horizons.
   

  

 Joignez-vous à nous, l’une des plus importantes entreprises de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.

title: Devops Manager
description:
Multiple locations Hybrid
  
  

Epassi’s purpose is to boost everyday well-being. We are a leading provider of employee benefit solutions across Europe. Founded in Finland in 2007, we were the first company in Europe (2008) to launch a mobile-payable employee benefit payment solution. Epassi has been recognized by the Financial Times as one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies multiple times.
  
  

Join one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies and help boost the wellbeing of millions of employees. You’ll work in a fast-paced, international environment where you can make a direct impact on scalable, secure digital services.
  
  

We are currently hiring a Devops Lead to be based in either Finland, Sweden or Germany!
  
  

Your mission
  
  

As a DevOps Lead, you will strengthen Epassi’s technology foundation and accelerate delivery of secure, high-quality, scalable services across Europe. You will lead and mentor a growing DevOps team, evolve our CI/CD pipelines and cloud infrastructure, and shape DevSecOps and AI-assisted engineering practices.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

Lead and mentor the DevOps team; foster collaboration, learning, and high performance
  
Own and evolve cloud infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines for fast, reliable automated delivery
  
Drive DevSecOps practices; embed security throughout the software lifecycle
  
Introduce and scale AI-assisted engineering practices to improve productivity and quality
  
Partner with engineering, product, and security on priorities, architecture, and best practices
  
Ensure observability, reliability, and performance via monitoring and incident management
  
Champion automation and resilience; reduce operational toil and bottlenecks
  
Contribute to long-term technology strategy and platform decisions
  
  

What success looks like
  
  

A thriving DevOps team with strong ways of working and continuous learning
  
Faster, smoother releases with fewer bottlenecks and stronger collaboration
  
Security embedded into everyday engineering practices
  
Practical adoption of AI-assisted engineering with measurable impact
  
Robust, scalable cloud platform ready for growth across Europe
  
  

What you bring
  
  

Several years of hands-on DevOps experience in a modern software environment
  
Experience leading or mentoring DevOps/SRE/Platform teams (scaling environment preferred)
  
Strong knowledge of cloud, IaC, containers, CI/CD, and observability
  
Experience with DevSecOps and secure software lifecycle practices
  
Familiarity with AI-assisted engineering tools/workflows (coding, testing, automation)
  
Pragmatic mindset and strong stakeholder collaboration skills
  
  

Competencies
  
  

Proactivity
  
Technical leadership
  
Collaboration & communication
  
Analytical problem-solving
  
Coaching & team development
  
Security & reliability mindset
  
  

Why join Epassi
  
  

**Purpose-driven work:** boosting everyday wellbeing
  
Open, inclusive culture with low hierarchy
  
Strong growth and opportunity to make an impact
  
Wellbeing-focused environment and benefits
  
  

Hiring manager & contact
  
  

**Hiring manager:** Pekka Pietikäinen, Head of Group IT
  
**Contact:** careers@epassi.com
  
  

Work with great people
  
Tianran Li
  
Product Owner
  
"Epassi is a youngster who is energetic and brings the best to the people. Best things working at Epassi is that we have good benefits. You can always learn something new and implement it in practice."
  
Aleksandra Wnuk
  
Backend Developer
  
"Work environment at Epassi is healthy and not stressful, and you can take part here in many interesting projects."
  
Marcin Gołubienko
  
Full Stack Developer
  
"During my work experience, I’ve got opportunity to touch every aspect of software delivery - not only from coding point of view."
  
Alexandra Andersson
  
Customer Service Agent
  
"The best thing about working at Epassi is colleagues. It is easy to get along with everyone, regardless of age and origin! My team has a good team spirit and we work well together to meet our goals!"
  
Great Place to Work
  
  

Company events
  
  

Hybrid and flexible working style
  
  

Modern working tools
  
  

International environment
  
  

Benefit package for wellbeing support
  
  

Private health support

title: DevOps Specialist
description:
At Mediaflow, we build smart tools for managing, storing and distributing digital media, helping organizations stay secure, structured, and efficient in their daily communication. As we continue to evolve our platform and scale our operations, we’re now looking for a hands-on DevOps Specialist with a background in development to join our growing tech team.  

  



**ABOUT US**

Mediaflow is a Swedish tech company with a user-first approach and a deep belief in clean design, automation and long-term thinking. Our platform is trusted by hundreds of organizations, from public institutions to global enterprises. Our headquarters is in Uppsala, while most of our tech and product development takes place in Gothenburg, where this role will also be based.


We are currently a DevOps team of three, working closely with one of the founders and the CTO. We combine daily engineering work with a long-term vision of building a modern and reliable infrastructure, and we’re now looking for someone who can strengthen both perspectives.


**THE ROLE**

As a DevOps Specialist at Mediaflow, you’ll take an active role in designing and improving the tools and systems that run our platform, with an emphasis on infrastructure, observability and performance. Your expansive experience as a backend developer will come in handy, as you’ll also help shape internal tooling, automation and system integration.


You’ll work closely with product development and be part of a tight-knit, pragmatic team with a lot of autonomy. Our current stack includes Kubernetes, MySQL, and Ubuntu Linux, running on a mix of physical servers and cloud environments. You’ll be involved in everything from daily operations to architecture decisions.


**Examples of responsibilities:**

* Operate and improve our Kubernetes clusters and Linux servers.
* Maintain and monitor physical servers and network infrastructure.
* Build and manage internal tools and services for the operations team.
* Work with CI/CD flows and backup systems.
* Ensure reliability, performance and observability across systems.
* Occasionally visit our datacenters (e.g. Falkenberg) when needed.
* Collaborate with development teams to ensure infrastructure readiness.
* Be open to future on-call models with compensation.

**THE TEAM**

You’ll join a small, focused DevOps team with high seniority and a collaborative culture. The team is distributed, but we aim to meet regularly at the office in Gothenburg. While fully remote work is not a requirement, we expect you to be available for on-site visits approximately once per month.  



##### 
**Your qualifications**

**Must-have:**

* Strong experience with Linux system administration in production environments.
* Deep understanding of Kubernetes and container orchestration.
* Proficiency with network infrastructure and physical server hardware.
* Solid programming background (e.g. Go, Python, Perl or backend development).
* Comfort working with databases (e.g. MySQL) and data transport/metrics.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and automation.
* A pragmatic mindset and willingness to take ownership.
* Good communication skills, English is the primary language used within the team.

It’s a bonus if you also bring experience with infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform or Ansible, and a solid background in backend development, ideally with around five years of hands-on coding experience. Familiarity with observability tools and alerting systems is also valuable. A driver’s license is useful, as occasional visits to our data centers may be needed. While a university degree is not required, we value proven, practical experience in the field.


**BENEFITS**

* High-impact role in a stable and growing product company.
* Small, autonomous team with a modern tech stack.
* Pragmatic working culture, structured where it adds value.
* Hybrid setup with flexibility to work both on-site and remotely.
* Office located in central Gothenburg.

**CONTACT**

This recruitment is handled by our recruitment partner Detechtiv. For questions, please contact Axel at axel@detechtiv.se or 076-038 04 28.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Att jobba som Azure DevOps specialist**
 Som Azure DevOps Specialist kommer du att ha en viktig roll i att möjliggöra effektiva, säkra och skalbara leveransflöden inom våra utvecklingsplattformar. Tillsammans med teamet är du med och utvecklar Skandias bygg- och leveransförmåga genom hela DevSecOps-kedjan – från kod till test som drift. Din vardag innebär nära samarbete med våra utvecklingsteam, arkitekter och interna driftorganisation där du bidrar till vår fortsatta automationsresa genom att kvalitetssäkra och optimera våra tekniska flöden.
   

  

 I din vardag kommer du bland annat att skapa ramverk för pipelines med hjälp av Managed DevOps Pools i Azure där du även ansvarar för att skriva YAML-konfigurationer. Du kommer att arbeta med feeds och pakethantering samt utvärdera nya verktyg och funktioner för att stärka våra tekniska flöden. En viktig del av din roll är att säkerställa att våra plattformar är förvaltade och livscykelhanterade samtidigt som du även arbetar med säkerhet som testautomatisering i leveransprocessen.
   

  

 Teamet du kommer till har ett tydligt fokus på automation, DevSecOps och Release on demand. Vi tror på frihet under ansvar, kontinuerlig förbättring och värdet av att dela kunskap. Vårt arbetssätt bygger på tillit, transparens och gemensamt lärande.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till gruppchef IT Test- & Utvecklingsstöd.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Vi ser att du har flerårig erfarenhet som Azure DevOps Specialist eller liknande tekniska roller. Du har en god förståelse för Azure DevOps som plattform och är van vid att arbeta med YAML, Git, PowerShell och C#. För att lyckas har du erfarenhet av att bygga och underhålla CI/CT/CD-pipelines samt att arbeta med pakethantering, feeds och automatiserade flöden.
   

  

 Det är viktigt att du har jobbat enligt agila metoder, gärna inom ramverket SAFe där samarbete, struktur och förändring går hand i hand. Du har dessutom ett genuint intresse för DevSecOps och en vilja att både förenkla och förbättra inte bara koden, utan även processer och arbetssätt. Ett grundkrav är att du kan svenska flytande både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Meriterande för rollen är om du har erfarenhet av molntjänster i Azure, hantering av containerplattformar och testautomatisering.
   

  

 Som person ser vi att du är teamorienterad, kommunikativ och engagerad. Du delar gärna med dig av din kunskap, är nyfiken på ny teknik och har ett lösningsfokuserat sätt att ta dig an arbetsuppgifter. Du är ödmjuk i din expertis och trygg i att ta en rådgivande roll gentemot andra team.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för urvalet.
   

  

 Läs mer om hela vår rekryteringsprocess här.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen vänligen ta kontakt med rekryterande chef Izabella Rolnik på izabella.rolnik@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Intregrationsspecialist till Sweco!
description:
*Är du en integrationsspecialist med några års erfarenhet som vill ta nästa steg i karriären? Vill du arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du får samarbeta med många olika delar av verksamheten? Då kan rollen som Integrationsspecialist hos Sweco vara perfekt för dig!*
**Din Vardag**
 Som Integrationsspecialist på Sweco IT blir du en del av teamet Masterdata & Integration inom IT Operations – ett agilt team på 8 personer som stöttar hela organisationen med data och integrationer till olika system och applikationer. Teamet arbetar i tvåveckorssprintar och har regelbundna mötesforum som dagliga standups, sprintplanering, retrospektiv och kunskapsdelning. Du kommer främst att underhålla och vidareutveckla integrationer mellan Swecos datalager och andra externa applikationer, såsom ekonomisystem och HR-system i olika länder. En vanlig dag importeras cirka 400 miljoner rader till datalagret.
   

  

 Som Integrationsspecialist arbetar du med integrationer som är både filbaserade och databas-till-databas, och får lära dig Swecos objektmodell och datalagerstruktur. Du samarbetar med tvärfunktionella team för att förstå krav och leverera innovativa lösningar, och deltar i projekt som löper över både kortare och längre perioder med olika delar av Sweco IT samt övriga verksamheten.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen som Integrationsspecialist tror vi att du har:
   

  

* 3–5 års erfarenhet av integrationer mellan system
* Avancerad kunskap om MS SQL och erfarenhet av MS SQL-databaser
* Erfarenhet av SSIS/ADF och Visual Studio
* Erfarenhet av DevOps är meriterande
* Flytande svenska och engelska
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av C#/.NET och Azure-plattformen


 Som person är du social, kommunikativ och gillar att samarbeta med olika parter. Du har ett starkt logiskt tänkande, är lösningsorienterad och strukturerad. Vidare är du proaktiv och tar initiativ i din roll, och har en vilja att ständigt utvecklas och dela kunskap med ditt team.
   

  

**Hur du ansöker**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Sweco med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, Gustaf Linder, gustaf.linder@wiseit.se. Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Processen kommer att starta i januari.
   

  

***Passar vi dig?***
 Transforming society together, we’re planning and designing sustainable communities and cities of the future. Sweco erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med stor flexibilitet, möjlighet till hybridarbete och en inkluderande företagskultur. Du får tillgång till förmånsportal, friskvårdsbidrag, bonusprogram och kollektivavtal. Teamet präglas av en familjär känsla och ett öppet klimat där social kompetens värderas högt.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Om rollen**
 Nu söker vi dig som har erfarenhet inom maskininlärning! Att vara anställd på B3 innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar. Vi ser gärna att du har vana att arbeta såväl självständigt som kundnära och är van vid ett agilt teambaserat arbetssätt.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som har:**
* Minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet inom maskininlärning eller liknande område
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller
* Gedigen erfarenhet inom minst ett programmeringsspråk (te.x. Python, Scala eller R)
* Erfarenhet av SQL och databashantering
* Erfarenhet av dataanalys- och visualiseringsverktyg så som Pandas, Matplotlib
* Kunskap om maskininlärningsbibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
* Behärskar god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Vad vi erbjuder:**
 Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på
 **kompetensutveckling** 
 , där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:
   

  

* Generös kompetensutveckling
* Attraktiv lönemodell
* En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning


**Om B3**
 B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord erfarenhet, olikheter och energi samt satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Lidia Hagos, för denna tjänst på lidia.hagos@b3.se.

title: Web3 - QA Engineer
description:
Are you experienced with Test Automation and ready for your next challenge? Our Product Development organisation spans across 4+ locations, with the most creative teams in the industry! If you are passionate about the latest technologies and can handle mission-critical responsibilities, then this is the role for you! We are looking for a QA Engineer to help us in the beginning of our journey to bring new and innovative iGaming products and brands to the market, leveraging the exciting possibilities provided by Web3 concepts and technologies.
 


**The Wow** 

 We are currently looking for an Automation Engineer to help us build and support our Brands quality coverage. As part of an end-to-end team, you will be applying your automation skills to cover a wide range of scenarios involving commercial and regulatory components, making sure no bugs reach our production environment and the need for manual coverage is reduced. You will also be responsible for contributing to our codebase directly, making changes to our components as necessary to increase our quality robustness.
 


**A taster of what you will be involved with** 

  
 


* Work on maintaining and improving our automation framework using latest trends, technologies and best practices to safeguard our product quality.
* Develop deep knowledge of our product in order to identify weaknesses in our coverage and address them.
* Continue promoting the Quality-Built-In mindset in our day-to-day work by assisting the other engineers and come up with process improvements.
* Research on tooling improvements, CI/CD pipeline configuration and Release process automation.
* Be directly involved in our product’s codebase with the ability to perform code changes on features in scope of adding better quality coverage, robustness and reduce time-to-market



  
 


 What we are looking for
 
  
 


* 2+ years experience in a similar role involving Quality •
* Good understanding of Quality methodologies, best practices and techniques for code coverage
* A passion for Quality and Development in order to bring the best experience to the customer.
* Confident in both written and spoken English



  
 


  Experience with libraries, frameworks and languages such as
 
  
 


* Cucumber
* Jest
* Puppeteer/ Playwright
* Typescript/ Javascript
* Experience with TeamCity and Github Action for CI/CD integration
* Familiar with tools such as JIRA, for issue tracking and Confluence;
* Self-starter, analytical and with a positive “can-do” attitude.
* Experience with Frontend libraries such as Angular would be considered a plus
* Experience in IGaming industry is considered a plus
* Degree or equivalent certification is considered a plus
* ISTQB qualification is considered a plus



  
 


 What we offer
 
 Much like riding a rollercoaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 1200 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognise it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
 



 We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, independence and celebrate success where you will be part of multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.
 


 Challenge Accepted?
 
***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy***

title: Data Engineer
description:
*At* 
***Norrin***
*, we’re shaping the era of Enterprise Intelligence. Our vision is to transform business productivity through data & AI by creating solutions that deliver measurable impact. As a Microsoft technology partner, we are at the forefront of reshaping how businesses operate across the Nordics. What defines us is deep technical expertise, a creative engineering mindset, and a people-first culture. You’ll have the chance to grow in a direction that matters to you while building solutions that make a real difference. With a strong presence in Finland and growing operations in Sweden, the United States, Thailand and Vietnam, we continue to expand our Nordic roots internationally. Most recently, Swedish company* 
***BizOne***
*joined the Norrin Group, further strengthening our presence across the Nordics.*
 We’re looking for
 **Data Engineers** 
 to join our growing team in Stockholm. You might be a data enthusiast with a couple of years under your belt or already a more seasoned professional. What matters most to us is your willingness to keep learning, take ownership, and work on solutions that create clear business value.
   

  

 In this role, you will get to work on a variety of cloud-based customer projects, designing and building modern data platforms and analytics solutions using Azure Data Platform services, Databricks, and AI-enabled tools. Your work may include data modelling, integrations, and architectural design, always in close collaboration with customers and internal experts. You will also be part of Norrin’s Data Engineering Guild, a community where knowledge is shared, skills are developed together, and people actively support each other’s growth.
   

  

**🌱Why Norrin?**
* People-first culture: A workplace where you can be yourself. Our culture is built on openness, equality, and mutual respect
* Flexible working model: Our hybrid model offers the best of both worlds, flexibility in your daily life and in-person collaboration when it moves things forward
* Fair compensation: A competitive salary that reflects your skills and experience
* Grow with us: We encourage continuous learning and development in a direction that matters to you


**✨ We value**
* 2-5 years of experience as a Data Engineer or in analytics solution development
* Experience building Databricks and/or Fabric-based solutions in an Azure environment
* Understanding of data warehousing, data modelling, and integrations
* Good collaboration skills and a customer-oriented mindset
* Curiosity and initiative to keep learning new things and stay up to date
* Ability to communicate technical solutions clearly, also to non-technical stakeholders
* Fluent Swedish and English skills


**🛠️ Your technical toolkit**
* Strong skills in SQL and Python/PySpark
* Experience building data pipelines using Databricks, dbt, Microsoft Fabric or similar
* Solid understanding of data security and privacy principles
* Experience with dimensional modelling
* Knowledge of DevOps and CI/CD principles


**Experience With**
 ➕
 **What’s a plus (but not required)**
* Power BI and automated reporting
* GenAI or machine learning, including MLOps
* Cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake.


**📩 Could this be your next step?**
 We’re excited to hear from you. Please submit your application as soon as possible. We will move forward with the recruitment process as soon as we find the right candidate.

title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
description:
About us:
   

  

 Legora is working to empower lawyers and automate legal work. Our approach is to enable the lawyer of the future: a human-AI lawyer who's an order of magnitude more effective than a team of conventional legal professionals. The human-AI lawyer will iterate at the speed of their judgment, even in the most complex legal scenarios, and will out-smart and out-deliver the best pure AI system.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit that thousands of lawyers use daily at global institutions such as Bird&Bird, Mannheimer Swartling, and Heineken. Backed by $37M in funding from top investors like Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator, Legora is a group of exceptional engineers, lawyers, and doers. Here, you will have infinite room to grow and rethink how truly worthwhile work gets done.
   

  

**The role:**
 As a Fullstack Engineer at Legora you will build, review and ship amazing products helping legal professionals all over the world in their day-to-day job. You’ll get the chance to work across the entire tech stack with clear ownership and autonomy.
   

  

 What you will be doing:
   

  

* Architect and implement features end-to-end for our web platform
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Work with technologies such as Python, React, Node.js, AWS, Azure and Kubernetes
* Review code and mentor junior colleagues to support them in their development, making the team even better!
* Drive continuous improvement and challenge us, the industry and yourself


 Who you are:
   

  

* A passionate engineer with several years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* You feel comfortable working across the entire tech stack, with focus on backend development
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the code you write
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about software architecture
* Experience in infrastructure and integrations are a big plus


 What’s in it for you:
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Legora for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: SAP BTP AI Solution Advisor Expert, Sweden
description:
**We help the world run better**  

At SAP, we keep it simple: you bring your best to us, and we'll bring out the best in you. We're builders touching over 20 industries and 80% of global commerce, and we need your unique talents to help shape what's next. The work is challenging – but it matters. You'll find a place where you can be yourself, prioritize your wellbeing, and truly belong. What's in it for you? Constant learning, skill growth, great benefits, and a team that wants you to grow and succeed.  

As a market leader in application software our purpose is to help the world run better and improve people’s lives. The promise we give is to help our customers to innovate, and to help them to run at their best. SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently, use business insight more effectively, adapt continuously, and grow sustainable. Here you will find a time to grow. There are no ready-made paths, you can walk and create the way for you. We foster a learning culture since our people is the key to our success. Our focus on customers and to help them run at their best has given us the opportunity to grow.

  

We are currently looking for an **SAP BTP AI Solution Advisor Expert** to join our team in Sweden. You will be working close with our customers (often large enterprises or strategic partners) to:

* Understand their **business problems** and Iterate based on real user feedback
* Translate vague goals into **concrete AI use cases**
* Lead and support proof-of-concepts with custom AI-powered solutions– **make SAP AI live**.
* You Integrate LLMs, ML models, or AI platforms into workflows to build LLM-based applications, supported by SAP Agent-based tools, and more.


You bridge the gap between **“cool AI demo”** and **“this runs in production and saves money.”**

 **What you'll do**:


As the Solution Advisor (SA), you will be the go-to person for the solution area or product questions within the sales team. You will leverage your deep expertise in the specific solution area to support the entire sales cycle, from identifying opportunities to post-sale customer support. Additionally, you will assist customers in expanding their current SAP footprint to maximize value for their organization.

* Provide deep solution-specific expertise to support new sales and adoption for key customers
* Provide both standard and customized/personalized solution demonstrations that bring SAP solutions to life and show customers the value of SAP.
* Support the Account Team by delivering solution presentations and events to identify and qualify new opportunities and drive adoption and consumption of SAP solutions
* Evaluate account qualification criteria to determine further investment in pursuing opportunities
* Establish yourself as a thought leader within the account team and fine-tune account strategy
* Collaborate with the team in creating overall themes and competitive differentiation
* Conduct vigorous dry runs on strategic deals and customer engagements
* Transition engagement to implementation partner/ Services teams effectively
* Engage with customers to continue selling the vision of SAP solutions and ensure eagerness for renewal
* Leverage digital assets throughout the customer engagement, including demos, presentations, and other content

 **What you bring:**

* Professional experience with large software/IT organizations, preferably in a solution-specific segment
* SAP product experience and/or 3-5 years of relevant solutions/technology experience
* Working knowledge of Cloud, Hosted Services, and Software as a Service/Platform as a Service models in the Business-to-Business Environment
* Viewed as a expert with deep AI skills, practical hands-on experience, ML, Data Scientist and Pro Coding skills.
* Focus on creating compelling storylines and themes for customer interactions
* Ability to quickly understand customer business goals and ensure they are at the center of recommended solutions
* Passion and energy in all customer interactions

 **Meet your team:**

* Customer Advocate: Collaborate to complement solution expertise and support customers
* Global Digital Content Factory: Leverage digital assets created by the team throughout customer engagement
* Implementation Partner/Customer Services & Delivery: Efficiently transition customer engagement for successful deployment and realization of solution value
* SAP Account Teams: Share best practices and collaborate on providing solutions and services support across the entire customer journey

 **Education and Qualifications / Skills and Competencies**

**Personal skills:**

* Bachelor equivalent: minimum requirement
* Master equivalent: optional
* Ability to work in international and virtual teams
* Fluency in Swedish and English, any other language an asset.

**Mobility**

  

* Ability and willingness to travel

 **Bring out your best**  

SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
  

  

**We win with inclusion**  

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better world.  

  

SAP is committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provides accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.  

  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.  

  

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability, in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local legal requirements.  

  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. **AI Usage in the Recruitment Process**
For information on the responsible use of AI in our recruitment process, please refer to our Guidelines for Ethical Usage of AI in the Recruiting Process.
Please note that any violation of these guidelines may result in disqualification from the hiring process.  

  

Requisition ID: 445352 | Work Area: Presales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: #LI-Hybrid
company_description: SAP's purpose is to help the world run better and improve people's lives with sustainability at the core.

title: Data Analyst
description:
We're looking for data analysts in Stockholm or Gothenburg to start during April-August, 2026. This position is perfect for data analysts that can work independently and are eager to learn from fellow analyst colleagues.

**About Conversionista**
------------------------


Conversionista is part of Eidra, and we specialize in helping businesses understand their data and make better decisions. Beyond analytics, we also help businesses improve their websites and digital experiences to achieve better results - whether that's more sales, sign-ups, or user engagement. We also work with user experience research and digital strategy.


Our insights team combines different approaches to get the full picture, we triangulate findings from both qualitative and quantitative research, drawing from multiple data sources to ensure robust conclusions.


Our analytics work focuses on:

* **Data analytics** - Working with raw data to understand behavior patterns and customer journeys
* **Data preparation and analytics engineering** - Transforming tables and datasets for dashboards and analysis
* **Experimentation** - Conducting A/B tests and other controlled experiments to measure business impact
* **Statistical analysis** - Applying hypothesis testing and statistical methods to validate findings
* **Experiment modeling** - Modeling experiment results and metrics to quantify business impact
* **KPI tracking and business metrics** - Monitoring performance indicators that matter to business success
* **Ad-hoc analysis** - Answering specific business questions through data exploration


We work extensively with web data, including Google Analytics exports in BigQuery. Understanding how events are tracked online is a major advantage in this role.

**What we don't do:** We don't build predictive models, machine learning algorithms, or complex AI systems. Our focus is on understanding what happened and why, not predicting what will happen.

**The Role**
------------


As an analyst, you'll dive deep into data and uncover insights that drive business success. Your role goes beyond collecting data, you'll make it accessible and understandable for others. You'll enable colleagues and clients to quickly access crucial information for important decisions.


This role is based in central Stockholm or Gothenburg. We work from our office or at client locations - this is not a remote position.


You'll join a team that prioritizes helping and supporting each other. Your colleagues are passionate and knowledgeable, constantly pushing themselves and each other to excel.

**Who You Are**
---------------


We look for people who share our foundational values.

* **You are solution-oriented.** You focus on finding solutions, not just pointing out problems. You take initiative and look for smart ways to create real value.
* **You are a team player.** You enjoy working with others and put the team first. You share your knowledge, give helpful feedback, and are open to learning from your colleagues.
* **You have a positive attitude.** You see challenges as opportunities to learn and grow. You are helpful and create a positive atmosphere for your team and our clients.
* **You are professional and committed.** You take responsibility for your work and deliver on your promises. You communicate clearly and act with integrity.

**What We're Looking For**
--------------------------

**Essential requirements:**

* 2+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, Analytics Consultant, Analytics Engineer, BI Developer or quantitative PhD studies within a relevant field
* Relevant university degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s in data science, statistics, business, economics, mathematics, engineering or similar) or similar work experience
* Excellent analytical skills and experience using various analytical and statistical methods on large datasets to generate insights
* Strong scripting/programming skills in SQL and Python
* Adaptability to work with various stakeholders and environments and interest and proficiency in communication and stakeholder management
* Professional English proficiency
* EU/EEA citizenship or valid EU work visa

**Preferred experience:**

* Cloud-based data infrastructure (Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Databricks, et al.)
* Web, product, or marketing analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Amplitude, Mixpanel, et al)
* Ability to work with version control systems (GitHub) and project management tools (e.g. Jira)
* Statistical analysis and experimental methodology
* Experience designing and analyzing experiments
* Swedish language skills

**About Eidra**
---------------


As part of Eidra, we embrace core values that guide how we work and interact with each other and our clients. We believe in continuous learning, collaboration, and delivering meaningful results.

**Start Date**
--------------


We are looking to onboard during our official Eidra onboarding week in April or August. We're excited to welcome you aboard!


Ready to turn data into insights that matter? Apply today.

**Applications open until Monday, March 2, 2026 at 23:59 CET**

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions supports health care professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.

**The position**


We are looking for an Infrastructure Engineer who will play a critical role in ensuring that Cambio’s internal IT environment is stable, secure, scalable, future‑proof, and aligned with our business needs. This role combines architectural ownership with hands‑on engineering — meaning you will both design the infrastructure of tomorrow and support the operational needs of today.


You will be part of Cambio’s transformation journey as we move from a traditional on-premise setup toward a modern hybrid and platform driven infrastructure. This includes building the technical foundation that will support our products, enabling automation, and Infrastructure as Code practices.


In this role, you will join a team of four experienced colleagues and collaborate closely with departments across Cambio, including IT Operations, R&D and external partners. You will contribute to designing our future architecture, driving change initiatives, supporting operational teams, and shaping an infrastructure that enables Cambio to scale securely and efficiently. The position offers significant influence, growth opportunities, and the ability to tailor parts of the role around your own technical passions.

**We offer:**

* **A key role in a transformation journey** — be a part of making the shift from traditional on prem infrastructure to a modern hybrid, platform driven environment built on automation & containerization.
* **A technically diverse role** — work hands on with OpenShift, hybrid cloud, automation frameworks, secure networking, virtualisation, and modern infrastructure patterns.
* **A collaborative environment** — work closely with IT Operations, R&D and key external partners, ensuring infrastructure truly supports product development and business growth.
* **A role that grows with you** — start hands on and gradually expand into more strategic responsibilities, depending on your interests and strengths. You’ll have the freedom to shape your own focus areas.

###### **Examples of** **responsibilities within the role**

* Design scalable infrastructure solutions across on‑prem and hybrid environments.
* Develop architecture patterns, technical roadmaps, and capacity plans.
* Act as an escalation point for complex infrastructure issues.
* Deploy, patch, and maintain core systems, networks, and virtual platforms.
* Lead troubleshooting and root‑cause analyses and support test/acceptance environments.
* Build and maintain scripts, tools, and automations to streamline operations.
* Contribute to IaC and containerization.
* Implement security controls across identity, access, servers, and endpoints.
* Collaborate with Security and IAM to ensure compliance with standards and regulations.
* Take end‑to‑end ownership of selected systems or infrastructure components.
* Manage upgrades, lifecycle planning, documentation, and platform consistency.

###### **About you**


You are a positive, solution-oriented person who enjoys tackling challenges with curiosity and drive. You take initiative, stay forward leaning, and thrive in an environment where things are evolving. Collaboration comes naturally to you — you value teamwork and contribute to a supportive and open atmosphere.


You communicate clearly and constructively, whether you’re explaining technical concepts or discussing priorities with colleagues. You take responsibility for your work, follow through on commitments, and are comfortable acting both as an architect and an engineer — and together with your team ensures that actions and decisions support the development of a stable, secure, and scalable internal IT environment.

**Requirements**

* Experience from a similar role within infrastructure and operations, as a engineer or architect
* Strong hands-on knowledge in Windows Server, AD/Azure AD, networking, virtualization (VMware/Hyper-V), storage, backup, monitoring
* Ability to troubleshoot complex multi-layer issues
* Experience with automation and scripting, preferably in PowerShell
* Great communication skills in English & Swedish, both spoken and written

**It's a bonus if you have**

* Experience building or integrating internal tools
* Experience supporting internal IT environments and end users
* Experience with self‑provisioning tools or platforms

 **Place of employment**: Linköping or Stockholm

**Scope**: Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)

**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
  

  

**Additional Information:** The role involves access to sensitive data, therefore a background check will be conducted on the final candidate.


We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.  

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**

**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**


Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life**.** Read more about us **here!**

 **A healthier tomorrow also means taking care of those who make it possible -**explore our employee benefits


Learn more about our recruitment process here.


Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.

title: Digital Trust and Cyber Security Management Consultant
description:
Göteborg, Stockholm


Digital Trust and Cyber Security Management Consultant


**Capgemini Invent**
At Capgemini Invent, we believe difference drives change. As inventive transformation consultants, we blend our strategic, creative and scientific capabilities, collaborating closely with clients to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Join us to drive transformation tailored to our client's challenges of today and tomorrow. Informed and validated by science and data. Superpowered by creativity and design. All underpinned by technology created with purpose

**Your role**
As a leading management consultancy, we help clients embrace new technologies while safeguarding their critical data and assets. We’re on a mission to continue to build the leading Digital Trust & Cyber Security management consulting team in Sweden, to be part of our existing Nordic team. With major market opportunities on the horizon and the strength of our global teams behind us, we’re assembling a powerhouse of entrepreneurial minds ready to take information and cyber security to the next level. If you’re passionate about building secure digital futures for clients and thrive at the intersection of strategy and execution, we want to talk to you.




In this role you will play a key role in:

* Design, develop, and implement cutting-edge cyber and data protection strategies and cybersecurity operating models.
* Develop robust governance, risk, and compliance frameworks, incorporating both traditional and innovative approaches.
* Guide clients through business resilience transformations, ensuring they are prepared for any crisis or disruption.
* Conduct performance improvement assessments and benchmarking clients' security posture against national and international standards.




**Your profile*** 2-6+ years’ work experience, ideally from management consulting or equivalent, with proven experience in leading projects in information or cyber security.
* A master’s degree with a information, cyber security, business, or IT focus.
* Proven experience with current cybersecurity management standards (ISO 2700x, NIST) and regulations (NIS/NIS2, CRA, DORA, GDPR).
* High integrity, collaborative spirit, and excellent presentation and communication skills.
* Swedish citizenship and **fluency in Swedish and English are required.**
* Relevant certifications (ISO 2700x, CISM, CISA, CISSP) are advantageous.
**What you'll love about working here**
At Capgemini Invent, you’ll be part of a global team shaping the future of our clients. We offer:

* Impactful Work: Drive transformation for some of the world’s leading companies, helping organizations define their strategic direction and put in place governance structures and delivery plans that turn vision into tomorrow’s ground-breaking services and solutions.
* Innovation at Scale: Work with cutting-edge technologies and strategies to solve complex industry challenges.
* Career Growth: Access world-class training, mentorship, and opportunities to accelerate your career.
* Collaborative Culture: Join a diverse, inclusive team that values creativity, curiosity, and bold ideas.
* Purpose-Driven Projects: Help clients build sustainable, customer-centric solutions that make a real difference.
**Need to know**
Location: In line with our trust-based culture, Capgemini Invent offers a hybrid working model, and for this role you will be based in one of our attractively located offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg, ready to travel to our clients’ sites when needed.




The seniority level and title will depend on your background and experience. **As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.**




Sounds like the next step in your career? We review applications on an ongoing basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible!

**About Capgemini**
Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 423,400 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55‑year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end‑to‑end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market‑leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2025 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

title: Product Manager – Messaging
description:
**ABOUT SINCH**

Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, PayPal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch’s Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.


Our Super Network, APIs, and applications enable teams across Sinch to operate, support, and scale messaging services reliably and securely worldwide.


At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple”, and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation.


**DESCRIPTION**

We are looking for a structured, commercially driven Product Manager to join our global Messaging organization.


This role spans two critical areas of our platform.


First, you will focus on the core of our business: continuously optimizing our global Messaging routing engine to maximize cost efficiency and increase automation across internal processes. Your work will directly influence margin performance and operational scalability.


Second, you will own product strategy for internal access management and tooling across Sinch’s messaging platforms. This includes defining and governing access rights, permissions, and user tooling to ensure the right level of access to messaging systems—while upholding the highest standards of security, compliance, and auditability.


As traffic across Sinch’s platform continues to grow at significant scale, your contribution will be pivotal in ensuring we remain the most intelligent, cost-efficient, and high-performing A2P messaging platform in the market. You will drive product initiatives that directly impact Gross Profit (GP), delivery quality, and operational excellence.


You will collaborate closely with Engineering, Data Science, Operations, and Commercial teams to deliver measurable improvements in efficiency, automation, and cost performance.


This role reports to the SMS Product Director and is based in Stockholm with a hybrid working setup.


What you’ll do:


* Own and execute the product roadmap for internal access management, defining roles, permissions, and governance models across messaging systems and tooling to ensure secure, compliant, and scalable operations.
* Lead the product strategy for operational efficiency within Messaging, identifying and prioritizing initiatives that improve automation, scalability, cost control, and delivery performance.
* Partner with Engineering, Security, and IT to design and implement robust, auditable access-control frameworks that protect sensitive data and tools while enabling operational agility.
* Collaborate with Engineering and Operations to eliminate manual processes, driving automation that improves reliability, reduces operational overhead, and minimizes revenue leakage.
* Define, track, and own KPIs related to cost efficiency, operational performance, and Gross Profit optimization, ensuring data-driven prioritization and measurable business impact.
* Continuously enhance our messaging platform through experimentation and data-driven iteration, leveraging analytics and feedback loops to unlock performance improvements at scale.
* Communicate clearly and effectively with stakeholders across time zones, translating complex technical and data insights into tangible business outcomes.

**REQUIREMENTS**

* An experienced Product Manager, Technical Product Owner, or Business Analyst with strong analytical and operational skills.
* Experience in telecoms, A2P/P2P messaging, or large-scale infrastructure optimization is highly desirable.
* Hands-on experience with internal access management, RBAC, permissions, or identity-related systems.
* Data-driven, with a solid grasp of SQL, data analysis, and BI tools (e.g., Qlik, Tableau). Hands-on comfort with data is essential.
* Highly collaborative—you can influence and build strong relationships with Engineering, Operations, and Commercial teams.
* Structured and outcome-oriented, with a proven ability to simplify complexity and prioritize for maximum business impact.
* A self-starter who thrives in a global, fast-paced environment and is passionate about using data to drive business results. Bachelor’s Degree required; a background in a technical or business discipline is preferred.

Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in **English** .


At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation at this time.


Applicants must:


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.

**OUR HIRING PROCESS**

We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.


We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Cyber Security Service Owner - Exposure & Vulnerability Management
description:
**Cyber Security Service Owner – Exposure & Vulnerability Management**


**Own the services that keep a global organisation ahead of cyber risk**


**Location:** Malmö, Sweden | Hybrid work  

**Group IT Security**

**Cyber resilience isn’t built by tools alone — it’s built by ownership**



Modern threats move fast.  

Strong organisations stay ahead by designing security services that are trusted, scalable, and continuously improving.



At ASSA ABLOY, you step into a role where your expertise shapes how exposure management is designed, delivered, and evolved across a global enterprise. Your decisions directly influence how vulnerabilities are identified, prioritised, and reduced — protecting both people and business every day.



If you’re motivated by autonomy, clarity, and building services that genuinely make a difference, this is where your ownership creates visible impact.



**Your role**


**Own. Shape. Strengthen.**



As **Cyber Security Service Owner for Exposure & Vulnerability Management**, you own the end-to-end performance, evolution, and business value of our exposure management services globally. You lead through influence, clarity, and collaboration — creating services that teams trust and leaders rely on.



You will work closely with a skilled and committed group of engineers, architects and service delivery partners, while partnering with stakeholders across IT, security and the wider business.



You will:  

* **Own the full service lifecycle:** Define, operate and continuously improve vulnerability scanning, cloud security posture management and penetration testing services.
* **Shape the roadmap:** Translate strategy into a clear service roadmap aligned with business priorities and cyber risk reduction.
* **Ensure service excellence:** Deliver stable, transparent and compliant services that meet agreed SLAs and operational expectations.
* **Turn insight into action:** Use performance data, KPIs and stakeholder feedback to drive continuous improvement and smarter decision-making.
* **Build trusted partnerships:** Act as the primary interface between technical teams, business stakeholders and vendors, balancing security, cost, and usability.
* **Strengthen resilience:** Own operational readiness, change control, incident escalation and root cause follow-up to keep services reliable and mature.


**What you bring**


* Hands-on experience **owning or operating cyber security services** in complex IT environments, delivering measurable improvements.
* Strong expertise in **exposure management**, including vulnerability management platforms, cloud security posture management and penetration testing.
* A pragmatic, analytical mindset, comfortable translating technical data into prioritised actions and service improvements.
* Relevant certifications such as ITIL, Security+ or CISSP (or equivalent practical experience).
* Fluency in English, with a collaborative working style across international teams.



**Why ASSA ABLOY**



Here, your work protects millions of people and organisations worldwide. You’ll operate in a culture built on trust, inclusion, and continuous improvement — with the freedom to shape how things are done, not just follow process.



You’ll benefit from:  

* **Meaningful mission:** Your work directly strengthens global security and resilience.
* **Innovation and scale:** Access to modern platforms, global environments, and complex challenges that stretch your expertise.
* **Autonomy and trust:** Scandinavian leadership culture that values ownership and smart decision-making.
* **Growth and development:** Global career opportunities, learning investment, and long-term progression.
* **Work–life balance:** Hybrid working and flexibility that supports sustainable performance.


**Ready to make your impact visible?**



If you want to own services that truly matter — and work in an environment where your expertise is trusted, your voice is heard, and your growth is supported — we’d love to hear from you.


**Apply today. Bring your expertise. Shape our future.**



We review applications continuously.  

We’re committed to building diverse, inclusive teams and encourage applications from all who see themselves thriving here.



To protect your personal data, we do not review applications sent via email or post.  

For questions about the process, contact Léa Rein, Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner.

  


**Let’s create a safer and more open world — together.**

  


**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**  

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.

As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.

As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

#LI-WGIE
